capability.name: Interbank Relationship Management
capability.definition: Manage the bank's relationship with other banks, covering any specific agreements that may be in place and overseeing operational issues.
capability.role: This function handles managed interbank relationships. There are a range of relationship considerations that may apply between banks covering trading arrangements, joint ventures, clearing and settlement arrangements etc. The Interbank Relationship Management function acts as a relationship planning and coordination point to facilitate interbank interactions
capability.example: A partner bank is contacted to review a major project opportunity. The interbank relationship management function is used to coordinate contacts for a joint venture marketing opportunity between the banks

key_features.name: Develop the bank relationship plan/targets
key_features.description: Enables develop the bank relationship plan/targets to support manage the bank's relationship with other banks, covering any specific agreements that may be in place and overseeing operational issues

key_features.name: Liaise/advise bank representatives and develop the relationship
key_features.description: Enables liaise/advise bank representatives and develop the relationship to support manage the bank's relationship with other banks, covering any specific agreements that may be in place and overseeing operational issues

key_features.name: Identify and develop mutually beneficial initiatives with the bank
key_features.description: Enables identify and develop mutually beneficial initiatives with the bank to support manage the bank's relationship with other banks, covering any specific agreements that may be in place and overseeing operational issues

key_features.name: Troubleshoot production issues that arise involving the bank
key_features.description: Enables troubleshoot production issues that arise involving the bank to support manage the bank's relationship with other banks, covering any specific agreements that may be in place and overseeing operational issues
